81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:28): d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1: I think if you call http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/content/base/public/nsContentUtils.h#1863 in your Init method
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:28): it'll cause the script object factory to get created
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:29): and the exception providers to get registered
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:29): (and in non-xpcshell contexts it won't do anything since the factory will have alreday been set up)
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:30): er, grumble
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:30): but that's private
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (15:30): trying to understand code
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:31): but the basic idea is the same
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:31): ask XPCOM to create the DOMScriptObjectFactory service
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:31): in the init method
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:31): so that the exception providers get registered
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (15:34): d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1: does that 9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57e sense?

81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (16:17): d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e: is there a reason that the hashtable guide says to use nsClassHashtable for strings?
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (16:17): isntead of nsDataHashtable?
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:19): are strings memmovable?
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:19): last I checked I thought they weren't
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (16:19): good question!
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:19): but it's also possible that datahashtable does copy construction, I don't remember that either
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:19): well, I guess you wouldn't ever be dealing with autostrings
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:20): so they probably are memmovable
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (16:20): nsHashKeys.h seems to believe that they are
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:20): short answer, I don't know why
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:20): data hashtable *sounds* ok, but as the key size starts getting bigger the allocated version becomes faster
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (16:20): seems like using nsDataHashtable would be more efficient
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (16:20): but strings are small
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (16:20): well, the non-auto versions anyways
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:20): yeayeah
d1db9b06f722657e4d9fd52c35ab706e (16:21): josh: what's the current status of the plugins-to-content patch? Still need examination of pandora?
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (16:26): is jfkthame on pto?
